Sentencas: The feasibility of a Ni-based cermet anode for direct hydrocarbon (HC) SOFCs was investigated with ethane fuel as a step towards utilizing higher HCs such as propane and butane.
Titulo: Feasibility of Ni-based cermet anode for direct HCSOFCs: Fueling ethane at a low S/C condition to Ni-ScSZ anode-supported cell

Sentencas: The possibility of stable operation of SOFCs with ethane fuel at a low steam/carbon (S/C) ratio of 1.2 mol% H2O-98.8 mol% C2H6 was investigated with anode-supported SOFCs utilizing a scandia stabilized zirconia (ScSZ) electrolyte and a Ni-ScSZ anode.
Titulo: Feasibility of Ni-based cermet anode for direct HCSOFCs: Fueling ethane at a low S/C condition to Ni-ScSZ anode-supported cell

Sentencas: Severe carbon deposition was observed around the anode especially at the fuel injection port during the cell tests at T=973K.
Titulo: Feasibility of Ni-based cermet anode for direct HCSOFCs: Fueling ethane at a low S/C condition to Ni-ScSZ anode-supported cell

Sentencas: The amount of deposited carbon became smaller with decreasing operation temperature, and a stable cell operation was achieved at T approximate to 823 K without severe carbon deposition over a week.
Titulo: Feasibility of Ni-based cermet anode for direct HCSOFCs: Fueling ethane at a low S/C condition to Ni-ScSZ anode-supported cell

Sentencas: However, at a low fuel utilization rate (U-f) around 20%, nickel was heavily disintegrated accompanied by severe carbon deposition even at T approximate to 823 K. With increasing U-f, the disintegration became less, and a stable cell operations were achieved only with a small amount of deposited carbon for over a week at high U-f > 46%.
Titulo: Feasibility of Ni-based cermet anode for direct HCSOFCs: Fueling ethane at a low S/C condition to Ni-ScSZ anode-supported cell
